com.almasb.fxgl.asset

Class AssetLoader

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.almasb.fxgl.asset.AssetLoader

  • public class AssetLoader
extends Object
    Handles all resource (asset) loading operations.

    "assets" directory must be located in source folder ("src" by default).

    Resources (assets) will be searched for in these specified directories:

    • Texture - /assets/textures/
    • Sound - /assets/sounds/
    • Music - /assets/music/
    • Text (List<String>) - /assets/text/
    • KVFile - /assets/kv/
    • Data - /assets/data/
    • Scripts - /assets/scripts/
    • CSS - /assets/ui/css/
    • Font - /assets/ui/fonts/
    • App icons - /assets/ui/icons/
    • Cursors - /assets/ui/cursors/
    Author:
    Almas Baimagambetov (AlmasB) (almaslvl@gmail.com)

    • Method Detail

      • loadTexture

        public Texture loadTexture(String name)
        Loads texture with given name from . Either returns a valid texture or throws an exception in case of errors.

        Supported image formats are:

        • BMP
        • GIF
        • JPEG
        • PNG

        Parameters:
        name - texture name without the , e.g. "player.png"
        Returns:
        texture
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if asset not found or loading error

      • loadSound

        public Sound loadSound(String name)
        Loads sound with given name from . Either returns a valid sound or throws an exception in case of errors.

        Supported sound format:

      • WAV
Parameters:
name - sound name without the , e.g. "explosion.wav"
Returns:
sound
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if asset not found or loading error

  • loadText

    public List<String> loadText(String name)
    Loads text file with given name from into List where each element represents a line within the file. Either returns a valid list with lines read from the file or throws an exception in case of errors
    Parameters:
    name - text file name without the , e.g. "level_0.txt"
    Returns:
    list of lines from file
    Throws:
    IllegalArgumentException - if asset not found or loading error

  • loadFXML

    public javafx.scene.Parent loadFXML(String name,
                                    UIController controller)
    Loads an FXML (.fxml) file from /assets/ui/. Either returns a valid parsed UI or throws an exception in case of errors.
    Parameters:
    name - FXML file name
    controller - the controller object
    Returns:
    a JavaFX UI parsed from .fxml
    Throws:
    IllegalArgumentException - if asset not found or loading/parsing error

  • loadCSS

    public CSS loadCSS(String name)
    Returns external form of of URL to CSS file (from ready to be applied to UI elements. Can be applied by calling object.getStyleSheets().add(). Either returns ready CSS or throws exception in case of errors.
    Parameters:
    name - CSS file name without the , e.g. "ui_button.css"
    Returns:
    css
    Throws:
    IllegalArgumentException - if asset not found or loading error

  • loadFont

    public FontFactory loadFont(String name)
    Loads a native JavaFX font with given name from wrapped in a FontFactory, which later can be used to produce fonts with different sizes without accessing the font file. Either returns a valid font factory or throws exception in case of errors

    Supported font formats are:

    • TTF
    • OTF

    Parameters:
    name - font file name without the , e.g. "quest_font.ttf"
    Returns:
    font factory
    Throws:
    IllegalArgumentException - if asset not found or loading error

    Loads an app icon from . Either returns a valid image or throws an exception in case of errors.
    Parameters:
    name - image name without the , e.g. "app_icon.png"
    Returns:
    app icon image
    Throws:
    IllegalArgumentException - if asset not found or loading error

  • cache

    public void cache()
    Pre-loads all textures / sounds / music / text / fonts and binary data from their respective folders.

  • clearCache

    public void clearCache()

  • loadFileNames

    public List<String> loadFileNames(String directory)
                           throws Exception
    Loads file names from a directory. Note: directory name must be in the format "/assets/...". Returned file names are relativized to the given directory name.
    Parameters:
    directory - name of directory
    Returns:
    list of file names
    Throws:
    Exception
